mitigations.description: Enforce TLS everywhere by configuring HTTPS on Route 53, ELB, EC2, CloudFront, and S3. Use AWS Certificate Manager for certificate management.
Implement secure session handling: use HttpOnly, Secure, SameSite cookies, enforce short session timeouts, rotate session tokens, and invalidate on logout.
Encrypt all data at rest: enable RDS encryption, S3 bucket default encryption (AES‑256 or KMS), and ElasticCache encryption. Ensure backups and snapshots are also encrypted.
Apply the principle of least privilege to all IAM roles and instance profiles. Use IAM Access Analyzer and regularly review policies to remove over‑permissive permissions.
Use parameterized queries or ORM frameworks and validate all user input on the server side to prevent SQL injection into RDS.
Encode all dynamic output and enforce a Content Security Policy (CSP) to mitigate XSS attacks from the web server.
